jobDescription: Job Description IMPORTANT: This program will have a start date of Summer 2023 (June/July) Job Summary: CSX is a Fortune 250 company seeking future business leaders to help foster growth, efficiency and innovation. Leadership Development Associates participate in a 6-month program aimed at developing the skills of future business leaders within the accounting organization. The accounting organization is responsible for managing and performing the accounting processes for CSX and all subsidiary companies which also includes financial reporting to the SEC, STB, and other regulatory agencies reporting and maintenance of effective accounting controls. The associate will serve in a full-time role within one of four core areas within accounting – Payroll & Labor Services, Accounting & Reporting, Revenue & Receivables, and Billing & Accounting Information Systems. Primary Activities and Responsibilities: Participate in and learn core areas of the accounting organization Participate and contribute to special projects that would support field employees, technology initiatives, customer relationships, financial and liquidity objectives, as well as reporting and compliance Process improvement projects designed to implement or improve best practices Conduct accounting research and summarize results Cross functional activities and miscellaneous activities as assigned by manager Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution required in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, Marketing, Engineering, Information Technology or related major field of study, to be completed by the start date indicated in this posting. Grade point average of at least 3.0 (based on a 4-point scale) required in the related major field of study for your highest degree Preferred Qualifications: In addition to meeting the above qualifications, any of the following are preferred: Master’s degree from an accredited institution in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance, to be completed by the start date indicated in this posting. 1 or more years of experience in Business, Finance, Accounting or Marketing or 2 or more related internships Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or CPA eligible Grade point average of 3.5 or higher (based on a 4-point scale) in the related major field of study for your highest degree Knowledge and Skills: Knowledge of United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) accounting concepts and principles Problem-solving and judgment skills Microsoft Office Skills Project execution and management skills Ability to communicate ideas clearly and effectively, both in writing and orally Ability to deliver oral presentations to a variety of audiences Ability to analyze data utilizing Microsoft Excel functions including pivot tables and complex formatting and functions Ability to interact with employees at various levels of the organization Ability to build relationships with business partners and customers Leadership The CSX Leadership Model is the foundation of our Talent Strategy and is what drives CSX performance. CSX accordingly selects and develops talent based on each of the following: producing results, creating change, and inspiring excellence. Job Requirements Work schedule may vary in length and schedule (may include a nonstandard workweek) Work inside an office environment with some travel and exposure to field operations Successfully complete a background check and drug test About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. More information about CSX Corporation and its subsidiaries is available at www.csx.com. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter . Closing Statement At CSX, two of our five Guiding Principles are Valuing and Developing Employees as well as Operating Safely. We are committed to offering our team members the most competitive compensation and benefits package available, unlimited opportunities for development and growth throughout an exciting and rewarding career, and the safest work environment possible. CSX is an Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans/Disabled. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Click here to view the EEO is Law poster. Click here to view the OFCCP pay transparency provision information. Any resumes submitted by an outside vendor to any employee at CSX via e-mail, Internet, or directly to hiring managers without a valid written search agreement in place with the Talent Acquisition / HR department will be deemed the sole property of CSX. No placement fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired as a result of the referral, or through other means.

Job Summary Job Description Regional travel may be required. Assist in the installation, repairing, testing and maintenance of various railroad signals and grade crossing protection equipment. Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Be able to safely perform all job responsibilities Perform work on signal equipment including electrical, mechanical, hydraulic and pneumatic systems Install signal/communication structures and component Lubricate moving parts on mechanical equipment such as switch machines, car retarders and controllers Use the risk management process to isolate potentially dangerous situations Prepare and paint signal equipment Inspect, test, repair and maintain communication/signal and electrical equipment Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Drive and operate medium to heavy duty vehicles daily. Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate Minimum entry rate of $29.40/hour. *Pay rates are progressive upon completion of all required apprentice training. Pay rates vary by location. Training Initially, you will attend training in Atlanta, GA., and two (2) additional training sessions that will be scheduled approximately 130 days apart. CSX will pay for travel, lodging and meals as required by collective bargaining agreement. Once training has been completed this position will advance to Signal Maintainer. Signal Maintainer rate of pay is $35.84/hr Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED You must currently possess a CDL or obtain one within 90 days of your start date 21 years of age or older Valid Driver's License Preferred Qualifications One or more years of outside work experience (e.g. construction, heavy equipment operator, farming, etc.) One year experience using Volt / Ohm meters One year experience interpreting circuit schematics or diagrams One year work experience in electronics, electrical, or electromechanical field Physical Requirements Heavy work, lifting up to 60 pounds occasionally and up to 85 pounds on a rare basis Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity/tracking/inspection Climb ladders and poles up to 40 feet to make repairs, tests and installations Work outside in all weather conditions and occasionally on uneven terrain Must meet color vision and hearing requirements as described in FRA Regulations Basic Competencies Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Basic Math Job Requirements Work safely to prevent on the job accidents and injuries Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations The applicant selected may be required to successfully complete a background check Must pass all required assessments Must pass a background screening This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is req. Extensive travel required Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. Job Summary Job Description SOX auditors assess key financial controls that support CSX’s external financial reporting (e.g., 10-K financial report) in accordance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act and external auditor requirements (e.g., PCAOB). Each year, a scoping assessment is performed to determine which controls are to be audited. In each of the audit areas, the Auditor I’s role is to perform specific audit procedures or steps under the guidance of an audit lead with some latitude in decision-making. To perform this work, this role will regularly interact with CSX management up to and including the manager level as well as with external parties (e.g., external auditors, contractors, etc.) as needed with limited supervision. The work requires documenting walkthroughs of processes, re-performance of management’s work, analyzing exceptions, and effectively communicating observations and conclusions to the audit lead and management related to specific audit steps assigned. Primary Activities And Responsibilities At the direction of the audit lead, perform pre-audit research and planning as necessary. Assist audit lead in developing risk-based audit procedures and performing walkthroughs to evaluate the design and effectiveness of business processes, internal controls and related technologies while assessing for potential fraud risk. Assist audit lead in communicating to management audit scope and objectives and document the results of procedures performed. During fieldwork for specific audit steps or internal controls assigned, interview management, gather and evaluate appropriate audit evidence, and document work to support conclusions. Utilize various data analytics tools and techniques to enhance efficiency, coverage, and value of audit activities. Manage self to meet defined project objectives and timelines. For specific audit steps or internal controls worked on during audit wrap-up and reporting, identify, research, and document issues and provide insights and recommendations to management. Assist IA&C leaders in drafting and issuing audit observations to management. Participate in cross-functional teams and initiatives to continuously improve departmental processes, systems, and talent training. Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree/4-year Degree 1 or more years of experience in Audit, compliance, Sarbanes-Oxley, fraud, technology, or related accounting field Preferred Qualifications Graduate Degree 1 or more years of experience in Audit, compliance, Sarbanes-Oxley, fraud, technology, or related accounting field Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) Certified Public Accountant (CPA) Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) Admitted Legal Bar License Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) Knowledge And Skills Knowledge of and skill in applying internal auditing and technology governance principles and practices, and management principles and preferred business practices Knowledge of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002; COSO Internal Control Framework; Control Objectives for Information Technology (COBIT); Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing, and the Code of Ethics developed by The Institute of Internal Auditors; and, the Association of Certified Fraud Examiners Code of Professional Standards Skill in documenting audit procedures and evidence supporting conclusions in line with established quality standards. Skill in collecting and analyzing complex data, evaluating information and systems, and drawing logical conclusions Skill in personal planning, time management, project management, and maintaining composure under pressure while balancing deliverables and deadlines for multiple discrete projects and task Skill in negotiating issues and resolving problems Skill in using word processing, spreadsheet, and other business software to prepare reports, memos, summaries, and analyses; Knowledge over Galvanize HighBond and ACL preferred Skill in effective verbal and written communications, including active listening skills and skill in presenting findings and recommendations Ability to establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with co-workers, business partners, and other external contacts, and to work effectively in a professional team environment Leadership The CSX Leadership Model is the foundation of our Talent Strategy and is what drives CSX performance. CSX accordingly selects and develops talent based on each of the following: producing results, creating change, and inspiring excellence. Job Requirements Work hours may vary in length and schedule (may include a non-standard work week) About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. Job Summary Job Description Makes accurate and detailed bridge inspections to ensure safe train movement.Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Climb bridges to thoroughly inspect their components. Make accurate, detailed inspections of designated structures to ensure their safe operation. Ensure that immediate action is taken to provide for the safety of train traffic, employees, and/or the public when critical defects are found. Prioritize defects. Ensure safety for self and others nearby. Report inspections electronically. Schedule and coordinate inspections weekly and perform duties with minimal direct supervision. Assist in the development of short-term and long-term programs. Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Minimum Qualifications Associates Degree/2-year Degree Less than 1 year of experience in Bridge Construction and Repair or Engineering (civil, structural or mechanical) Equivalent Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED 1 or more years of experience in Bridge Construction and Repair or Engineering (civil, structural or mechanical) Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's Degree/4-year Degree 1 or more years of experience in Structural Construction/Maintenance or Engineering (civil, structural, electrical, or mechanical) and/or Bridge Inspection Professional Engineer (PE) Knowledge and Skills Knowledge of construction, structures, components, and engineering Knowledge of Railroad industry Microsoft Office skills (especially Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint) Leadership The CSX Leadership Model is the foundation of our Talent Strategy and is what drives CSX performance. CSX accordingly selects and develops talent based on each of the following: producing results, creating change, and inspiring excellence. Job Requirements Available to report to work with two-hour advance notice Ability to report to work with 30 minutes advance notice Wear protective equipment (such as welding shields, hard hat, hearing protection) Work at elevated heights Work outside in all weather conditions Work flexible days/hours as dictated by business needs About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. Job Summary Job Description Install, maintain, replace and repair electrical and electronic communications equipment. Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Install, maintain, replace, and check communication equipment including, but not limited to, cables, computers, printers, monitors, radios, telephones, modems, wireless components, security cameras, batteries, connectors, various parts and testing equipment Cut, splice, and pull cable on ground, poles, and towers Use trenching equipment to bury equipment and cables in ground Receive and record inventory delivery Retrieve parts from inventory to install and maintain equipment Transport tools and equipment to jobsite by truck Install wiring in offices and field locations Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate $33.11hour*Pay rates may vary by location Training You will be required to attend paid training as required by your collective bargaining agreement. Please note that training may occur outside of your work location. Qualifications - External Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED Valid Driver's License 21 years of age or older You must currently possess a FCC license or be able to obtain one within 90 days of your start date You must currently possess a CDL or be able to obtain one within 90 days of your start date Two years of experience in communications related field Preferred Qualifications Commercial Driver's License (CDL) Class A with Airbrake Endorsement Two years of experience operating heavy equipment Two year technical degree or equivalent experience in network management Physical Requirements Heavy work, lifting up to 70 pounds occasionally and up to 100 pounds on a rare basis Climb ladders and poles up to 40 feet to make repairs, tests and installations Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Basic Competencies Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Basic Math Job Requirements May require regional travel Work safely to prevent on the job accidents and injuries Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations The applicant selected may be required to successfully complete a background check Must pass all required assessments Must pass a background screening Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is req. Job Summary Job Description Install, maintain, replace and repair electrical and electronic communications equipment. Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Install, maintain, replace, and check communication equipment including, but not limited to, cables, computers, printers, monitors, radios, telephones, modems, wireless components, security cameras, batteries, connectors, various parts and testing equipment Cut, splice, and pull cable on ground, poles, and towers Use trenching equipment to bury equipment and cables in ground Receive and record inventory delivery Retrieve parts from inventory to install and maintain equipment Transport tools and equipment to jobsite by truck Install wiring in offices and field locations Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate $33.11hour*Pay rates may vary by location Training You will be required to attend paid training as required by your collective bargaining agreement. Please note that training may occur outside of your work location. Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED Valid Driver's License 21 years of age or older You must currently possess a FCC license or be able to obtain one within 90 days of your start date You must currently possess a CDL or be able to obtain one within 90 days of your start date Two years of experience in communications related field Preferred Qualifications Commercial Driver's License (CDL) Class A with Airbrake Endorsement Two years of experience operating heavy equipment Two year technical degree or equivalent experience in network management Physical Requirements Heavy work, lifting up to 70 pounds occasionally and up to 100 pounds on a rare basis Climb ladders and poles up to 40 feet to make repairs, tests and installations Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Basic Competencies Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Basic Math Job Requirements May require regional travel Work safely to prevent on the job accidents and injuries Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations The applicant selected may be required to successfully complete a background check Must pass all required assessments Must pass a background screening Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is req. About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. Job Summary Job Description Manages the construction of a safe, maintainable, and reliable railroad infrastructure including track, bridges, culverts, tunnels, etc. that serves to protect and safeguard CSX Transportation's (CSXT) current and future operations. Responsible for approximately 1 - 15 complex project(s) per year with minimal guidance. Coordinates outside party projects with consultants and departments of transportation as assigned. Scope of project(s) valuing approximately $15-25 million annually. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Work with various groups within CSX (Public Projects, Maintenance of Way, Bridge & Tunnel, Communications & Signal, Environmental, Properties Services, etc.) and with other entities outside of CSX Transportation (General Engineering Consultants, State DOT's, etc.) to develop overall construction plan and in service plan for Infrastructure Projects. Provide construction management support to project work teams (CSX Maintenance of Way, CSX Signal Construction, Civil Engineering & Track Contractors, and others) to execute the construction of railroad infrastructure projects (Industrial Development, Coal Development, etc.). Assist with the development of Project Budgets and manage the budgets to construct the Infrastructure Projects. Review and approve invoices and contractor expenses associated with Infrastructure Projects. Prepare and present project status reports using Project Management Tools on a regular basis to monitor project construction status. Perform or participate in Project Quality Assurance Reviews with internal and external work teams. Conduct weekly and monthly Safety Observations. Participate in CSX Design & Construction Quarterly Meetings and Safety Overlap Meetings. Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree/4-year Degree 1 or more years of supervisory experience required in leading or managing Construction of Infrastructure Projects (Civil & Track / Bridge & Tunnels) Equivalent Minimum Qualifications Associates Degree/2-year Degree 3 or more years of supervisory experience required in leading or managing Construction of Infrastructure Projects (Civil & Track / Bridge & Tunnels) Preferred Qualifications Professional Engineer (PE) Certification Knowledge and Skills Knowledge of civil engineering including construction methods, surveying, design, estimating, and forecasting Ability to create, read, and understand design drawings and specifications Project management skills including scheduling software Computer-aided design (CAD) skills such as AutoCAD and / or MicroStation Knowledge of various computer systems i.e., ORACLE Ability to communicate effectively with senior leadership, employees, vendors, and contractors Knowledge of state, local, and federal laws/regulations pertaining to building standards Intermediate Microsoft Office skills to include Word, Excel, Outlook Leadership The CSX Leadership Model is the foundation of our Talent Strategy and is what drives CSX performance. CSX accordingly selects and develops talent based on each of the following: producing results, creating change, and inspiring excellence. Job Requirements May be required to complete a background check Wear protective equipment (such as welding shields, hard hat, hearing protection) Work hours may vary in length and schedule (may include a non-standard work week) Work outside in all weather conditions About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. Job Description CSX Technology is seeking interns for a 10+ week immersion into our organization. Individuals will complete challenging assignments in a collaborative team environment directly contributing to innovation, transformation, and delivery of corporate results. Our internships provide an opportunity for candidates to preview full-time opportunities at CSX, gain practical experience, and build professional networks. Primary Activities and Responsibilities: Interns will be placed with a technology team based on their skills, aspirations, and active company initiatives. Possible teams include: Applications Development (Java and Angular web development), Data Science & Analytics, Cybersecurity, Agile Delivery, Software Infrastructure (including Automation and Cloud), User Experience, IT Operations, Integrations/API, Project Management, Robotics/Drones, GIS, Field Infrastructure, and Service Support. Regardless of team placement, all technology interns play an important role in advancing and delivering Technology initiatives. The expectations of these compensated positions include, but are not limited to: Active contribution in a dynamic, agile team environment Adherence to best practices for developing and maintaining secure systems Root-cause analysis to iterate improvement and increase reliability and efficiency Engagement across teams and stakeholders, to ensure shared understanding and value delivery Minimum Qualifications: Must be at least 18 years of age  Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related major field of study from an accredited institution. Job Summary Job Description Develops designs and estimates of multiple infrastructure and capital projects to produce a safe, maintainable and reliable railroad. Works with the Project Manager and coordinate with CSX Track, Signal & Civil Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Transportation, Public Agencies, Outside Parties and various consultants to design and estimate project costs. Work is complex in nature and is carried out with limited guidance. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Develop projects including scopes, estimates, initial designs, working across multiple internal departments, external stakeholders and engineering disciplines. Become proficient with Micro-station and Google Earth to develop conceptual sketches Develop an understanding of CSX Design and Construction, Maintenance of Way and Industrial Development Standards & Procedures that will be used to create project designs Work with CSX Design Engineering Signal Construction, CSX Track & Civil Construction, CSX Environmental Group, CSX Real Property, Property Services and CSX Transportation Group to develop Infrastructure Projects. Develop project estimates for the construction of complex Infrastructure Projects and prepare Authority For Expenditure's (AFE's) for review and input. Participate with CSX Standards to evaluate new signal and track equipment and designs to ensure conformity to CSX Safety and Standard Policies. Review invoices and Contractor Expenses associated with Infrastructure Projects. Support onsite and virtual project meetings with Internal Departments, External Stakeholders, General Engineering Consultants GEC and Signal Engineering Consultants SEC. Participate with Engineering Department Safety Initiatives including Monthly Safety Overlap Meetings, best practice job reviews and safety incident reviews. Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree/4-year Degree in Engineering (civil, structural, electrical, electronic, or mechanical) or Construction Management Equivalent Minimum Qualifications Associates Degree/2-year Degree 5 or more years of experience in Engineering (civil, structural, electrical, electronic, or mechanical) or Construction Management Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's Degree/4-year Degree 5 or more years of experience in Engineering (civil, structural, electrical, electronic, or mechanical) or Construction Management Professional Engineer (PE) Project Management Professional (PMP) Knowledge And Skills Basic computer-aided design (CAD) skills such as AutoCAD and/or MicroStation Project Management Skills Leadership skills Knowledge of engineering methods including design, estimating, surveying Knowledge of CSX standards and American Railway Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association (AREMA) recommended practices. Knowledge of Federal Railroad Administration regulations and rules Intermediate Project Management Skills including scheduling software Intermediate skills in Microsoft Office Tools (Excel, Power Point, Word, Outlook) Proven time management skills to achieve deadlines and within prescribed timelines Ability to create, read, and understand design drawings and specifications Intermediate Oracle skills Leadership The CSX Leadership Model is the foundation of our Talent Strategy and is what drives CSX performance. CSX accordingly selects and develops talent based on each of the following: producing results, creating change, and inspiring excellence. Job Summary Job Description The Director of Operations Finance will be responsible for supporting CSX’s Transportation department, consisting of $1.5 billion in expense, from a finance perspective. This role will provide strategic thought leadership, people leadership and financial analytical expertise related to the Train and Engine workforce and associated expenses and operational metrics. This role is also responsible for consolidating the total Operations department expenses for communication to financial planning and analysis team and executive leadership. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Manage and develop finance professional staff Lead planning process for $1.5 billion in Transportation department expenses Develop a positive working relationship with all business partners, providing insightful financial information that supports accountability and leads to tangible initiatives or actions Ongoing analysis and reporting of financial performance versus established targets, prior business results and relevant industry benchmarking Review financial performance with business partners and identify areas to improve financial performance Establish and lead cross-functional initiatives aimed at improving company performance Accurately forecast financial performance and provide broader strategic view of relevant revenue, expense and capital expenditure areas Other relevant financial activities and responsibilities as assigned Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Minimum Qualifications external audiences Strong financial and analytical skills Experience with executing financial planning, forecasting and reporting processes Time management and organizational skills Mentorship and and deliver presentations for various audiences Demonstrated ability to create innovative solutions to business challenges Microsoft Office skills Leadership The CSX Leadership Model is the foundation Job Summary Job Description Perform all types of building construction and maintenance-related work including, but not limited to: reading blueprints, sketches, or building plans for information pertaining to type of material required and dimensions of structure or fixture to be fabricated; layout/build/construct forms and chutes for pouring concrete footings, walls, columns, and decks using a variety of hand tools and power tools and materials including aluminum joists, adjustable joists, shoring, and lumber; builds stairs, lays out and installs partitions using a standard industry materials; drywall installation, finishing, and painting; acoustic ceiling grid installation; and finish carpentry including cabinets and trim installation. May also be called upon to perform any number of miscellaneous tasks such as installation of safety cables and railing, light bulb replacement, minor plumbing repairs, floor covering installation, operate machinery, and other duties as assigned. Will respond to emergency situations as required and may work with other trades as necessary. Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Perform tasks associated with bridge and building construction, maintenance, upkeep, and repair Load and unload materials and tools Measure and cut material to fit Set up hoisting equipment for moving tools and material Participate in safety initiatives, job briefings and routine administrative actions Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety and operations as well as all applicable government regulations Pay Rate Entry Rates: 90% First Year - $28.09/hour 95% Second Year - $29.65/hour 100% Third Year - $31.21/hour Training You will attend training in Atlanta, GA. CSX will pay for travel, lodging and meals as required by collective bargaining agreement. Job Description Primary Activities and Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Perform general maintenance and repairs on bridges Set up hoisting equipment for raising and placing structural steel components Verify vertical and horizontal alignment and bolt or weld structures are in place Load and unload materials and tools Pay Rate Full Rate $ 31 . 21 /hour Training You will attend two weeks of training at the Railroad Education & Development Institute in Atlanta, GA. CSX will pay for travel, lodging and meals as required by collective bargaining agreement. Minimum Qualifications Qualifications - External High School diploma/GED 18 years of age or older Valid Driver's License Construction experience with basic carpentry skills Mechanical experience Read and interpret structural blueprints Preferred Qualifications Commercial Driver's License (CDL) Welding experience Bridge maintenance work experience Basic Competencies Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications--both general and technical) Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Mechanical aptitude Physical Requirements Heavy work, lifting up to 70 pounds occasionally and up to 100 pounds on a rare basis Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/balance/climb on an occasional basis Climb ladders and/or scaffolding Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity/tracking/inspection Fall protection requirements of <300Lbs Employment Conditions Commercial Driver's License (CDL) may need to be obtained based on job assignment Qualify to use a welding torch within 60 days of employment Work safely to prevent on the job accidents and injuries Wear protective equipment such as fall protection and rescue equipment, hard hat, hearing protection, safety-toe boots, or safety glasses Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety and track worker rules examination May require random testing for drugs and/or alcohol Must pass all required assessments Must pass a background screening Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including drug and physical capabilities test Regional travel may be required based on job assignment This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement, membership is required Environmental Conditions Work outside in all weather conditions at elevated heights and/or over water. Job Summary Job Description Operate and maintain bridges to ensure the safe passage of water traffic and trains. Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Observe and receive signals from approaching vessels Communicate with train dispatchers and vessel operators using two-way radio and telephone Operate automatic and semi-automatic equipment to open and close bridges Record time, direction, and name of vessels passing through opening Document and record preventive maintenance histories Inspect drawbridge, track, passing railcars and auxiliary equipment for defects and debris Perform routine maintenance and repairs on bridge operating parts and equipment and prepare summaries on repairs Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate Entry Rate First Year - $27.21/hour Second Year - $28.72/hour Third Year - $30.23/hour Training You will attend two weeks of training at the Railroad Education & Development Institute in Atlanta, GA. jobTitle: Engineering - Rail Plant Technician, Russell, KY
jobDescription: Job Summary Job Description Work as a member of the rail plant crew welding continuous rail, performing various pre-weld, welding, and post welding tasks along with miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Operate equipment and machinery associated with rail welding facility Inspect all equipment daily to check for leaky cylinders, hoses or connections Perform grinding tasks using power and hand tools Conduct quality inspections of work performed at the rail welding facility Maintain a safe and clean work environment Meet productivity goals established by manager Other duties as assigned Rate of Pay 28.00 / hour Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma / GED One year of welding experience Knowledge And Skills Railroad industry knowledge Welding experience FRA regulatory knowledge Job Requirements Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity/tracking/inspection Wear personal protective equipment (PPE) such as hard hat, hearing protection, steel-toe work boots, reflective safety vest, and safety glasses. This lists only the basics other PPE maybe required depending on job task. Exposure to equipment that intensifies the heat factor on an occasional basis This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is required. Federal regulations require random testing for drugs and/or alcohol. Work in a dynamic environment with many distractions. The applicant selected for this position may be required to successfully complete a background check and physical including a drug test. Job Summary Job Description Perform electrical inspection, construction, maintenance, and repair activities on power distribution equipment, floodlight towers, power poles, moveable bridges, generators, turntables, air conditioning units and other fixed electrical facilities. This will include Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) and Variable Frequency Drive (VFD) systems. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Ensure compliance with National Electrical Code, National Electrical Safety Code and the Standard for Electrical Safety in the Workplace (NFPA-70E) Install and maintain high and low voltage, overhead and underground wiring and equipment such as: switch heaters, control systems, conduits & cables, cross arms, pole mounted fixtures, transformers & capacitors, outdoor substation apparatus, air systems, fire alarm systems, motors & generators, year/building power & lighting, heating systems, switchboards & meters, battery charging, systems, welding machines, and UPS systems Understand, troubleshoot, install, maintain, and operate Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) and Variable Frequency Drives (VFDs) associated with motor control systems on moveable bridges and turntables Install and maintain all classes of exterior/interior wiring for electric, power and roadway lights, including overhead lines, up to 15kv Install and maintain electric systems and navigation lights on bridges Inspect equipment before each use Handle testing instruments for measuring voltage, current power, insulation resistance, etc Work with power companies and other vendors to plan and complete job activities Interpret and follow electrical codes, manuals, schematic diagrams, blueprints and other specifications Remove and replace defective poles and install conduits and conductors, dig by hand or mechanical means and set poles with the aid of mechanical equipment Operate one-man bucket attached to boom of line or bucket truck May maneuver fiberglass one-man bucket attached to boom of line or bucket truck Know the locations of cutouts and switches in areas of service in order to shorten power outages Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate $33.09/ hour plus $0.30 CDL Differential Pay for total of $33.39/hour Training You will attend paid training, which could be out of town. CSX will pay for travel and lodging as required by collective bargaining agreement. Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED 18 years of age or older Valid Driver's License One year experience reading and interpreting technical drawings or schematics Licensed Journeyman Journeyman Electrician Ability to obtain a Commercial Driver's License (CDL) within 60 days after start Preferred Qualifications Commercial Driver's License (CDL) Master Electrician Physical Requirements Heavy work, lifting up to 70 pounds occasionally and up to 100 pounds on a rare basis Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity/tracking/inspection Distinguish color coded wiring Basic Competencies Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Basic Math Job Requirements Work safely to prevent on the job accidents and injuries Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations Federal regulations require random testing for drugs and/or alcohol Must pass all required assessments Must pass a background screening Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test May require regional travel This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is req. Job Description This is not a CSX Transportation position. Successful applicants will report to Springfield Terminals. Job Summary Work as a member of a crew to install new railroad track, maintain existing track and right-of-way. Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Participate in group discussions including unit meetings, job briefings, safety meetings or process reviews Remove and replace track and track components (e.g. ties, rails, bars, etc.) Replace or repair track switches with specific components Slide and align tie plates Drill holes through rails for insertion of bolts and tighten or loosen bolts at joints that hold ends or rails together Correct deviations in track surface, alignment and gauge Cut rails to specific lengths Receive instructions, requests, orders, and information from posted bulletins, memorandums, rules and regulation manuals Adjust, lift and roll rails Sort track material for loading and unloading Install and repair street and railroad crossings Cut brush and vegetation from the right-of-way Spray switches, angle bars and joints with oil for lubrication Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate Entry Rates: 90% First year - $24.44/hr. - 100% Second Year - $27.15/hr. Training You will attend training in Atlanta, GA. CSX will pay for travel, lodging and meals as required by collective bargaining agreement. Minimum Qualifications Qualifications - External High School Diploma/GED 18 years of age or older Valid Driver's License Ability to obtain a Commercial Driver's License (Class A or Class B) within 60 days of hire Preferred Qualifications One or more years of outside work exp (e.g. construction, heavy equipment op, farming, etc.) Welding experience Commercial Driver's License (CDL) Commercial Driver's License (CDL) Class A with Airbrake Endorsement Physical Requirements Heavy work, lifting up to 60 pounds occasionally and up to 85 pounds on a rare basis Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Exposure to equipment that intensifies the heat factor on an occasional basis Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity/tracking/inspection Basic Competencies Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Basic Math Job Requirements Work safely to prevent on the job accidents and injuries Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations Must successfully pass probationary period This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is req. May require system-wide travel Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. More information about CSX Corporation and its subsidiaries is available at www.csx.com. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter . Job Description This is not a CSX Transportation position. Successful applicants will report to Springfield Terminals. Job Summary Job Description Employees must work towards qualifying to complete repairs and maintain all aspects of rail including frogs, rail-ends, turn-outs, switch points, and glue joints using arc, propane or thermite welding processes. Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all railroad rules and regulations for safety, operations and the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Inspect all equipment daily to check for leaky cylinders, hoses or connections Perform grinding tasks using power and hand tools Assist other employees in changing out rail Replace rail anchors, drive spikes and tamp ballast as needed Clean work pieces to remove impurities, such as slag, rust and grease Monitor and maintain flow of gases, light torch and adjust gas mixture and pressure to obtain desired flame when making field welds Apply filler rod to molten area to form weld Repair or replace broken or cracked rail and build-up rail, trim weld, grind the surface of rail, and grind gauge sides Inspect weld after grinding to check for hairline cracks or any visible defects Operate propane torches and electric and gas welding equipment Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate Full Rate $30.23/hour Training You will attend training in Atlanta, GA. CSX will pay for travel, lodging and meals as required by collective bargaining agreement. Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED 18 years of age or older Valid Driver's License Preferred Qualifications Commercial Driver's License (CDL) Experience in Shielded Metal Arc Welding (SMAW) and/or Flux Core Arc Welding (FCAW) One or more years of outside work exp (e.g. construction, heavy equipment op, farming,etc) Welding certification Physical Requirements Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity/tracking/inspection Medium to Heavy Work, lifting up to 60 pounds occasionally Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Exposure to equipment that intensifies the heat factor on an occasional basis Basic Competencies Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Mechanical aptitude Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Job Requirements This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is req. Required to maintain this position for 6 months before bidding Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations Must successfully pass probationary period Must pass all required assessments Must pass a background screening Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots May require regional travel About CSX CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. More information about CSX Corporation and its subsidiaries is available at www.csx.com. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter . Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED 21 years of age or older Valid Driver's License Must currently possess a CDL or be able to obtain one within 60 days of start date Preferred Qualifications Commercial Driver's License (CDL) - Class A or B Experience in Shielded Metal Arc Welding (SMAW) and/or Flux Core Arc Welding (FCAW) One or more years of outside work experience (e.g. construction, heavy equipment op, farming, etc.) Welding certification Physical Requirements Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity/tracking/inspection Medium to Heavy Work, lifting up to 60 pounds occasionally Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Exposure to equipment that intensifies the heat factor on an occasional basis Basic Competencies Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Mechanical aptitude Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Job Requirements This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is req. Required to maintain this position for 6 months before bidding Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations Must successfully pass probationary period Must pass all required assessments Must pass a background screening Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots May require regional travel About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. More information about CSX Corporation and its subsidiaries is available at www.csx.com. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter . Job Summary Job Description Employees must work towards qualifying to complete repairs and maintain all aspects of rail including frogs, rail-ends, turn-outs, switch points, and glue joints using arc, propane or thermite welding processes. Employees must be able to meet and comply with the manufacturer's weight limitation safety rating and recommendations for any equipment associated with performing their duties, including the 300 lb. safety rating for ladders (both portable and affixed) and fall arrest equipment. Applicants will be considered for either a Welder or a Welder Helper position. Evaluation of job title will include relevant skills and experiences, interview results, and various other job-relevant evaluations. Job Summary Job Description Join our executive administrative team at CSX! We are looking for an energetic and customer service focused administrative professional to support our executive team. This position will handle a variety of administrative functions in a fast-paced work environment. Apply today to be part of our professional administrative team! Primary Activities And Responsibilities Performs a variety of tasks focused on providing outstanding administrative support as part of the executive administrative team. Receives and routes telephone calls via multi-line phone system, communicating with the highest level of professionalism and customer service. Performs day-to-day administrative functions such as filing, mailings, data entry, correspondence tracking, and document production as well as other basic office duties such as ordering supplies and processing invoices. Schedules conference rooms for executive meetings. Greets customers and visitors, notifies appropriate executive, and directs them to proper conference areas. Remains flexible and open to additional requests for support or assistance outside of the scope of this job description and to other duties as directed by the executive office manager and subject to gained experience and familiarity with the industry. Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED 1 or more years of experience in experience in supporting executives, government officials, or serving in an administrative support Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's Degree/4-year Degree 2 or more years of experience in supporting executives, government officials, or serving in an administrative support Knowledge And Skills Must have a track record of impeccable attendance. Strong customer service experience with an extremely professional phone presence. Previous experience working as a receptionist, secretary or office assistant. Ability to successfully work in a fast-paced environment, prioritize well and multi-task. Excellent time management, organizational and planning skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to operate office equipment and systems such as Wi-Fi, internet, printers, scanners, copiers, and phone systems Proficient computer skills - MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Outlook) Teams, Zoom, WebEx experience is preferred. Job Description Internship Summary: CSX is a Fortune 250 company seeking future business leaders to help foster growth, efficiency and innovation. Interns are placed within the Finance Department for a 10 week immersion into CSX methods and culture. Individuals complete challenging real-world assignments, working hand in hand with leaders across the company to improve decision-making and financial performance. Finance internships provide an opportunity for candidates to experience what a role in corporate finance looks like, while allowing CSX to actively recruit tomorrow’s best talent. Primary Activities and Responsibilities: Individuals play a key role in completing identified finance projects. These projects are a glimpse into the day-to-day activities of a finance professional, including: Cultivating relationships with internal business partners to analyze marketing, operating, and capital projects and understand economic tradeoffs to help make real-time business decisions Providing analytical support for operations reviews, resource allocations, and financial valuations Guiding the development of short- and long-term forecasts, plans, and strategies. Developing and utilizing financial models to quantify benefits and drive sound, fact-based economic decisions Consulting and communicating analyses through presentations to senior management in the department and business partners from other departments Minimum Qualifications: Must be at least 18 years of age Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Business Management, Information Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related major field of study from an accredited institution Cumulative minimum GPA of 3.0 (based on a 4-point scale) Preferred Qualifications: Anticipated graduation within a year after the end of the internship Cumulative minimum GPA of 3.5 (based on a 4-point scale) Knowledge and Skills: Academic distinction with financial or quantitative interest/talent Proven leadership ability and initiative Strong communication, interpersonal, and influencing skills Ability to develop and deliver presentations to a senior level audience Proficient in Microsoft Office Job Requirements: Work inside an office environment Communicate effectively with senior leadership/executive audiences Work within established deadlines Successfully complete a background check and drug test Careers at CSX About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. jobTitle: Freight Conductor - Springfield Terminal - Portland, ME
jobDescription: Job Description This is not a CSX Transportation position. Successful applicants will report to Springfield Terminals. Job Summary A conductor's primary responsibility is to safely coordinate train crews on a freight train, place rail cars to facilitate loading and unloading, and makeup/breakdown trains in a rail yard, customer facility or similar locations. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Ensure compliance with all train orders, signals, railroad and safety rules and Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) regulations Be able to safely perform all job responsibilities Inspect all equipment on cars prior to departures Receive and transmit information by radio and telephone Read and understand bulletins, work orders, and switch lists Assist with the coupling and uncoupling of cars, operate switches, and make minor repairs to railcars, including replacing heavy couplings or air brake hoses Work with customers to ensure accurate movement and placement of cars; delivers excellent customer service by identifying customer needs and meeting or exceeding expectations Maintain awareness of surrounding area and suspicious activity to ensure rail safety Comprehend color and/or hand signals and systems Review instructions from dispatchers and other transportation employees, and discuss with locomotive engineer Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate While training rate of pay is 70% of the entry level rate ($33.45). Which would be $23.42 After OJT, the pay rate goes as follows until the conductor achieves 100% 1st year 75% - $25.08 2nd year 80% - $26.76 3rd year 90% - $30.11 4th year 100% - $33.45 Training You will attend four weeks of training at the Railroad Education & Development Institute (REDI) in Atlanta, GA. Springfield Terminal will pay for travel, lodging and meals. You will complete additional weeks of on-the-job training at your assigned location(s). Qualifications Minimum Qualifications At least 18 years old One year verifiable work experience Ability to read and comprehend all instructions including operating rules, bulletins, regulatory documents and other written communications Proficient verbal and written communication skills Preferred Qualifications One or more years of outside work exp. (e.g. construction, heavy equipment op, farming, etc.) Experience working in a safety sensitive environment Physical Requirements Must be able to mount and dismount moving equipment Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Work in cramped, confined, enclosed, or awkward places Ride on the outside of rail equipment for long periods of time Walk long distances over uneven terrain Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity/tracking/inspection Must meet color vision and hearing requirements as described in FRA Regulations Frequent lifting up to 80 lbs. Basic Competencies Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Job Requirements Work safely to prevent on the job accidents and injuries Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Work hours are based on seniority, new hires primarily work nights, weekends, and holidays Must be able to safely report to work within two hours of being notified to report in Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations Federal regulations require random testing for drugs and/or alcohol Must pass all required assessments Must pass a background screening Strict disciplinary policy regarding inability to report to work within proper time frame Advancement to engineer position. Must have minimum one year conductor experience. Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test About Us CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 200 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 230 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. Please apply internally for consideration in the following link: https://fa-eowa-saasfaprod1.fa.ocs.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX Job Summary Provides system and end user support for Oracle Cloud HCM application in a complex, dynamic environment. Performs analysis and problem resolution. Review quarterly releases, make recommendations and communicate changes & enhancements. These activities include the definition of needs, benefits, and strategy Primary Activities and ResponsibilitiesContinuously develop advanced knowledge of HCM cloud utilizing vendor websites, user groups and training to effectively utilize system capabilities Plan for and support migrations, releases, upgrades and/or patches, including functionality and design review, end to end user testing Develop test plans/scripts, execute testing scenarios and validate results Work with vendor to communicate and resolve issues. Access and communicate risk to management with recommendation and strategy to mitigate the risk Consult with functional owners to translate system needs into system requirements and effectively communicate system capabilities and limitations, partnering with the team to determine best options for design decisions based on documented requirements, current configuration, and downstream impacts. Document final specs and configure application Propose and develop reporting and dashboards that empower end users to make informed decisions Ensure system integration functionality, including review of integration specifications and development suggestions, troubleshoot integration issues Provide production support as an escalation point including, but not limited to, researching and resolving system or integration issues, unexpected results or process flaws Support the development and maintenance of integrations/file transfers Ensure data integrity through audit, review, updates, and maintenance Identify capabilities to ensure data quality and data integrity within all in/outbound employee management systems Ensure compliance with all Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) processes Strong focus on the "employee experience" supporting self-service transactional and reporting needs Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Minimum QualificationsBachelor's Degree/4-year Degree 5 or more years of experience in Human Capital Management systems, preferably Oracle Cloud (Fusion) Equivalent Minimum QualificationsAssociates Degree/2-year Degree 7 or more years of experience in Human Capital Management systems, preferably Oracle Cloud (Fusion) Knowledge and SkillsKnowledge of Human Capital Management Systems, preferably Oracle Cloud Knowledge of CoreHR and/or Benefits preferred Understands the HR and Total Rewards business processes supported by the HR systems Ability to work with process owners, subject matter experts to define functional requirements and specifications and quickly develop an understanding of the business need and business process Ability to interact effectively with people who have varying degrees of functional knowledge and draw out the real nature of the problem that needs to be solved Foundational knowledge of HR subject matter and services, including but not limited to benefits, compensation, talent acquisition, performance, and learning Ability to communicate effectively with the HR end users to understand the system issues that surface and how the issues relate to their business process and then performing the analysis necessary to identify the root cause of the issue Ability to coordinate multiple projects and react quickly to changing priorities, and prioritize work Strong customer service, analytical and organizational skills with the ability to solve problems creatively Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment Leadership The CSX Leadership Model is the foundation of our Talent Strategy and is what drives CSX performance. CSX accordingly selects and develops talent based on each of the following: producing results, creating change, and inspiring excellence. Job RequirementsWork hours may vary in length and schedule (may include a non-standard work week) Our Commitment to Operate Safely Led by our Guiding Principles, CSX is committed to protecting its employees, customers and the communities in which we operate. Therefore, as a condition of employment, successful external candidates for all positions and internal craft employees accepting management positions must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Successful candidates will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination within three days of the position start date unless approved for a medical or religious accommodation. Should the successful candidate seek a medical or religious accommodation, appropriate documentation must be provided in support of such request

Job Summary Job Description Support all roles and functions within the Income Tax Compliance group to ensure regulatory compliance and timely and accurate income and franchise tax reporting for federal, state, and foreign jurisdictions. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Work under supervision to prepare income, franchise, excise, and information reporting tax returns, Process requires data analysis, identification of common tax sensitive transactions, and application of appropriate tax treatment. Work independently to analyze and respond to tax notices, including correspondence with taxing jurisdictions. Work includes identification of issues, gathering return information, and analysis of return data. Work with other members of the income tax compliance group to assist in the extraction and analysis of data and other information needed for tax return preparation. Prepare income/franchise tax payment vouchers and process tax payment requests through Oracle, including estimated payments and extensions for all jurisdictions Support special projects and cross-functional department initiatives, including process improvements, tax planning, etc. Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree/4-year Degree 2 or more years of experience in Accounting or income tax Preferred Qualifications Graduate Degree 2 or more years of experience in Public accounting experience, preferable Big Four. Focus on Tax. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) Knowledge and Skills Knowledge of Federal and state income tax laws Knowledge of Financial Accounting Microsoft Office skills, with strong knowledge of Excel Ability to effectively execute income tax compliance responsibilities and projects Ability to communicate effectively Ability to maintain attention to detail Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Strong analytical skills Strong drive for results Leadership The CSX Leadership Model is the foundation of our Talent Strategy and is what drives CSX performance. CSX accordingly selects and develops talent based on each of the following: producing results, creating change, and inspiring excellence. Job Summary Job Description Perform auto body work and paint cars, car components, and finish locomotives with a professional high gloss auto finish. Primary Activities And Responsibilities Perform auto body work on locomotives and paint / finish locomotives with a professional high gloss auto finish. Paint stencils and identification markers on locomotives. Painting with bushes, varnishing, surfacing, decorating, lettering, cutting of stencils Operate and use required tools and equipment skillfully and safely, including paint spraying and sand blast machines Clean surfaces in preparation for coating, using cleaning fluids, solvents, brushes, or scrapers Removing paint and rust Read and interpret drawings, specifications and assembly instructions Ensure materials and equipment needed for production are ready and the work area is prepared Perform visual inspections to ensure quality standards are met Maintains appropriate service and repair records Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager Pay Rate Full Journeyman Rate: $37.74 Training Rate - $33.97/hour training rate (1st 366 work days - 90% of Journeyman rate. 2nd 366 work days - 95% of Journeyman rate. Full Journeyman Rate $37.74. Training You will attend paid training, which could be out of town. CSX will pay for travel and lodging as required by collective bargaining agreement. Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma/GED 18 years of age or older Valid Driver's License Experience with blue print/schematic reading Physical Requirements Lifting up to 50 pounds occasionally, up to 83 pounds on a rare basis Stoop/bend/kneel/crouch/crawl/balance/climb Demonstrate auditory and visual acuity and ability to recognize colors Exposure to equipment that intensifies the heat factor on an occasional basis Basic Competencies Verbal comprehension (Understand oral and written communications) Communication skills (provide clear instructions/directions) Reasoning skills (problem solving and troubleshooting skills) Job Requirements Work safely to prevent on the job accidents and injuries Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, or safety-toe boots Work hours may include a nonstandard workweek, overtime, and various shift work Complete annual training and pass safety rules examinations Must pass a post-offer medical examination, including a drug test Must pass all required assessments The applicant selected may be required to successfully complete a background check This position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement and membership is req.
